\item Summary Statistics:

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline

{Unit}{Vars} & N & Mean &  SD. & Median\\
\hline 
x1 & 25 &  42.40  & 27.89 & 35 \\\hline
x2 & 25 & 53.28 & 25.03 & 52 \\\hline
x3 & 25 & 54.20 & 27.26 & 57 \\\hline
y & 25 & 1526.80 & 3460.68 & 593 \\\hline
\end{tabular} 
\end{center}

\item The correlation matrix:

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline 
\diaghead{\theadfont Diag Column}%
{Vars}{Vars} & x1 &  x2 &  x3 & y\\
\hline 
x1 & 1.0 &  -0.04 & -0.21& 0.05\\\hline
x2 &  -0.04 & 1.0 & 0.35 & -0.43 \\\hline
x3 & -0.21 & 0.35 & 1.0 & 0.09\\\hline
y & 0.05 & -0.43 & 0.09 & 1.0\\\hline
\end{tabular} 
\end{center}

\item  The following table displays the OLS results using $y$ as dependent variable. We can see that only the relationship between $x2$ and $y$ is statistically significant.

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{c|ccccccc}
\hline 
\head{\theadfont Column}%
{}{} & (1) &  (2) &  (3) & (4) & (5) & (6) & (7)\\
{}{} & y &  y &  y & y & y & y & y\\
\hline 
x1 & 5.990 & & & 3.821 & 8.761& & 11.18\\
 & (25.84) & & & (23.81) & (26.89) & & (23.74)\\
x2 &  & -60.27** & & -60.10** & & -73.96**&-74.45** \\
 &  & (25.95) & & (26.53) & & (27.14) & (27.65) \\
x3 & & & 11.50 & & 13.40 & 35.52 & 38.11\\
& & & (26.36)& & (27.51) & (24.92) & (25.95)\\
CONSTANT & 1,273 & 4,738*** & 903.4 & 4,567** & 429.1 & 3,542* &2,954\\
 & (1,303) & (1,522) & (1,593) & (1,886) & (2,181) & (1,709) & (2,141)  \\
 &  & & &  & &  &\\
Observations & 25 & 25 & 25 & 25 & 25 & 25 & 25\\
R-squared & 0.002 &0.190&0.008&0.191&0.013&0.259&0.266\\
\hline
&Standard &errors &in&parentheses&height\\
&***p<0.01&**p<0.05&*p<0.1\\
\end{tabular} 
\end{center}
\end{enumerate}

\begin{enumerate}
\item R Code:\\
$library(gdata)\\
setwd("/Users/Lee/Dropbox/Git")\\
prbm1 <- read.csv("_data_problem_Set_01.csv",header=T,sep=",",quote="",dec=".",fill = T,comment.char="")\\
prbm1\\
rgs <- lm(prbm1$y ~ prbm1$x1+prbm1$x2+prbm1$x3)\\
summary(rgs)\\
cor (prbm1)\\
require(psych)\\
describe(prbm1)\\
summary(prbm1)$\\
\item Stata Code:\\
$cd "/Users/Lee/Dropbox/Git/"\\
insheet unit x1 x2 x3 y using"/Users/Lee/Dropbox/Git/_data_problem_Set_01.csv"\\
reg y x1\\
outreg2 using "results.xls",replace\\
reg y x2\\
outreg2 using "results.xls"\\
reg y x3\\
outreg2 using "results.xls"\\
reg y x1 x2\\
outreg2 using "results.xls"\\
reg y x1 x3\\
outreg2 using "results.xls"\\
reg y x2 x3\\
outreg2 using "results.xls"\\
reg y x1 x2 x3\\
outreg2 using "results.xls"$\\
\end{enumerate}
